page.title: 02The Town of Markinch
page.content: This town,which was a burgh in its own right until recently,is fighting to retain its identity as Glenrothes building projects come ever closer. Currently the population of several thousand feel an affinity with their own school,clubs and local institions but they also utilise some of the more costly facilities provided only by Glenrothes,such as swimming,cinema and the sports centre.The whisky_producing and bottling company of John Haig closed lately after more than a century of giving employment to this area.The work people of a good skilled type and obtained re-employment more readily than most in these times of great unemployment.The current largest employer is the Tullis Russell paper making company.All other firms in the town are small concerns.The local railway station also serves Glenrothes
